tool.name: DEXSeq-Count
tool.description: Prepare and count exon abundancies from RNA-seq data

param.name: aggregate
param.label: Aggregate genes with exons?
param.help: Indicates whether two or more genes sharing an exon should be merged into an 'aggregate gene'. If 'no', the exons that can not be assiged to a single gene are ignored.

param.name: qual
param.label: Skip all reads with alignment quality lower than the given minimum value

param.name: order
param.label: Sorting order of alignments
param.help: If you generated your alignments using tophat, they are by default position sorted. Ignored for single-end data

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
The main goal of this tol is to count the number of reads/fragments per exon of each gene in RNA-seq sample. In addition it also prepares your annotation gtf file compatible for counting.
**Inputs**
Mode-preprare: Takes a normal gtf file as input. For example from ensembl database. Mode-count: Inputs are flattened gtf file and BAM file. The flattened gtf file can be generated from 'prepare' mode of this tool.
**Output**
Mode-preprare: Flattened gtf file that contains only exons with corresponding gene ids from given gtf file. Sometimes two or more genes sharing an exon will be merged into an 'aggregate gene' if the aggregate option was used. Mode-count: Two column tab-delimeted file with exon ids and their read counts.
.. _DEXSeq: http://master.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DEXSeq.html
